subject: RE: [junit] Performance of the  ant task
msgSnippet: ... That would be a total lifesaver.  Any timeframe on that? Thanks and regards, Magnus ps. I m sorry for mixing up my ant tasks, but some products have
messageBody:
>
> > maybe the solution is to offer both options. i.e. You could set
> > fork="no", "once", or "always". or something along those lines.
>
> With "true" being an alias for "always" for backwards compatibility?
> That would work, yes.
>
> Stephane Bailliez is currently working on a reimplementation of that
> task (it really needs some heave refactoring) and I think his
> implementation will always be forked and be equivalent to the "once"
> case above - I'll have to check.
>
> Stefan
>

That would be a total lifesaver. Any timeframe on that?

Thanks and regards,

Magnus

ps. I'm sorry for mixing up my ant tasks, but some products have created
their own ant tasks and other tasks are created by the ant group, so
that is where the misunderstanding comes from.
